justification: “These parameters describe three core computational mechanisms underlying decision making: pre-decisional bias (or equivalently baseline activation or statistical prior) …” which is operationalized by the DDM starting point.

The paper notes that the drift rate in the diffusion decision model "describes change in activation/use of evidence during choice deliberation," tying the construct of evidence accumulation rate to the DDM drift rate parameter.
The authors state that the decision boundary parameter represents “activation threshold/acceptable error,” thereby measuring the construct of the decision threshold or extent of deliberation.
